newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador to sign $121 mln pipeline deal next week.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador to sign $121 mln pipeline deal next week.

text.p: The government of Ecuador said Thursday it expected to sign a $121 million financing deal next week with five foreign oil firms for the expansion of the Transecuador oil pipeline.
The agreement involves U.S. companies Occidental, Oryx, City Investing and ARCO and the Argentine oil company YPF.
"We've progressed quite a lot. There is a meeting of the directors to resolve the tariff system... We would be ready to sign the deal next week," Energy Minister Raul Baca told Reuters.
The project foresees increasing the pipeline's capacity to 410,000 bpd within one year and 480,000 bpd by the end of 1998 from its current 330,000 bpd.
Of Ecuador's total oil output of 390,000 bpd, 330,000 is carried along the Transecuador pipeline and the rest by the TransAndes pipeline.
